sections.heading: Reason for Referral
sections.content: Ms. Jane Doe is being referred to the cardiology clinic for further evaluation of newly identified palpitations and intermittent chest discomfort that have not resolved with initial management in the primary care setting.

sections.heading: History of Present Illness
sections.content: The patient reports a two-month history of episodic palpitations, described as a rapid and irregular heartbeat, occurring several times per week and lasting for a few minutes each episode. She also notes mild chest pressure associated with some episodes, without radiation or associated syncope. There is no history of prior cardiac disease. Over-the-counter antacids and rest have not alleviated her symptoms.

sections.heading: Relevant Medical History
sections.content: Ms. Doe has a history of mild asthma, well-controlled with inhalers. No significant family history of cardiac disease. She does not smoke, drinks alcohol occasionally, and exercises regularly. Current medications include albuterol inhaler as needed.

sections.heading: Examination and Investigations
sections.content: On examination, vital signs were stable and cardiovascular exam was unremarkable. Baseline ECG in clinic showed normal sinus rhythm. Basic metabolic panel and thyroid function tests were within normal limits. No other abnormalities detected.

sections.heading: Assessment
sections.content: Ms. Doe presents with new onset palpitations and intermittent chest discomfort of unclear etiology. Differential diagnosis includes paroxysmal supraventricular tachycardia, premature atrial or ventricular contractions, and anxiety-related symptoms.

sections.heading: Plan and Recommendations
sections.content: Referral to cardiology is recommended for further assessment, including possible Holter monitoring, echocardiogram, and additional cardiac workup as indicated. Patient is advised to record frequency and duration of episodes and avoid stimulants such as caffeine. She will continue follow-up in primary care for asthma management.
